body_html:
@AnlanSun Your code appears to generate checkpoint filenames numbered by epoch. You load the checkpoint from epoch66 and then start counting from zero, saving a new checkpoint every 1000 training steps. Are you sure you didn't accidentally overwrite your checkpoint file at some point?

PS. Copying the file, e.g. using scp ought to be just fine.
body_text:
@AnlanSun Your code appears to generate checkpoint filenames numbered by epoch.  You load the checkpoint from epoch66 and then start counting from zero, saving a new checkpoint every 1000 training steps.  Are you sure you didn't accidentally overwrite your checkpoint file at some point?
PS. Copying the file, e.g. using scp ought to be just fine.
body:
@AnlanSun Your code appears to generate checkpoint filenames numbered by `epoch`.  You load the checkpoint from epoch66 and then start counting from zero, saving a new checkpoint every 1000 training steps.  Are you sure you didn't accidentally overwrite your checkpoint file at some point?

PS. Copying the file, e.g. using `scp` ought to be just fine.
